title: Progressive Symmetric Erythrokeratoderma (PSEK): Clinical Overview and Diagnostic Considerations
short_description: Clinical document describing progressive symmetric erythrokeratoderma, a rare genetic skin disorder characterized by symmetrical, progressive plaques of thickened, reddened skin.
long_description: This clinical reference document provides a comprehensive overview of Progressive Symmetric Erythrokeratoderma (PSEK), a rare genetic dermatological condition first described by Darier in 1911. The document details the characteristic presentation of well-demarcated, symmetrical plaques of erythematous, hyperkeratotic skin that typically manifest in infancy and progress throughout early childhood. It covers the clinical spectrum, variable severity within families, potential associations with other keratodermatoses, diagnostic approaches including genetic testing and histopathological examination, and epidemiological data indicating fewer than 100 documented cases in medical literature.
